definition: lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!

sentences.english: The boy rattled off the poem he had learnt .
sentences.chinese: 那個男孩將他學到的那首詩背得滾瓜爛熟。

sentences.english: I can recite many Tang poems by heart.
sentences.chinese: 我把唐詩背得滾瓜爛熟。

sentences.english: He memorized many Tang poems thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 他能把許多唐詩背得滾瓜爛熟。

sentences.english: The actor had his lines down cold.
sentences.chinese: 這演員把臺詞背得滾瓜爛熟了。

sentences.english: She has the whole poem off (by heart) already.
sentences.chinese: 這首詩她已全部背得滾瓜爛熟。

definition: Guwen Guanzhi, an anthology of essays written in Literary Chinese, compiled and edited by Wu Chucai and Wu Diaohou of Qing dynasty
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
(of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
to notate music/to write a score
